result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Gerald Ferguson

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:06 a.m.  Court calls all cases (STC/Prelim/ARGN) and cites appearances.  Def appears in person, in custody.  Atty Carly Sebion appears via Zoom.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Atty Sebion indicates def will be waiving Def waives prelims in Cases 21CF74 and 22CF07.  Court questions def. re waiver of rights.  Def states he understands.  He discussed w/his atty.  No questions to ask or threats made to him.  Court finds def knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waiving prelims in 21CF74 and 21CF07.  Court reads counts.  Def understands charges.  Waivers accepted by Court.  DA:  Info counts will mirror complaint.  22CF20.  Atty Sebion waives reading of info/complaint.  Def pleads NG on all both counts.  In 21CF74, Atty Sebion waives reading of info/complaint.  Def pleads NG on all counts. In 22CF7, def pleads NG per Atty Sebion.  Parties need to sit down and discuss.  9/15 at 1:30 p.m.  PTC set.  Covers all cases.  Atty Sebion brings up bond.  Need same for him to attend funeral as long as last week.  Sat funeral.  Leave Thurs noon and Monday back.  Court agrees to modify bond.  $20,000 cash bond/sig bond to take effect at 9:00 Thurs morn. prov. only go to funeral location and be back by Monday at noon.  Adj.  11:17 a.m.  Clerked by wmg/typed by klr
to Court from Vics re bond revocation

2:34 p.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Atty Sebion appears via Zoom.  Def appears in person, in custody.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Atty Sebion addresses Court.  Is requesting signature bond or lower cash bond.  Def is revoked by probation as this time.  Def asks for bond modification or furlough to take care of mother's estate.  Court questions def.  Court questions sheriff.  DA addresses Court.  Def explains MI bond.  Is only requesting to be released from Friday through Sunday.  Service in Oxford on Saturday.  Sister indicates she would pick up def.  Court further questions def's ability to post bond.  Court converts to $50,000 sig bond with provision that def report back to  ICJ Monday at 9:00 a.m.  Converts back to  $20,000 cash at 9:00 a.m.  Vic rts complied with.  Other conditions in place.  Still DOC hold.  Bond change effective immediately.  Adj.  2:45 p.m.  klr
**NOTE:  THIS BOND CONVERTS BACK TO ORIGINAL $20,000.00 CASH BOND EFFECTIVE MONDAY, 8/29/22 AT 9:00 A.M. **  Def shall have no contact with victims R.L. and J.H. (known to def).
Converted to signature bond of $50,000.00 w/conditions.

Exhibit #1:  VCJ Booking Photo of Def.
Exhibit #2:  Copy of Snapshot from Video Surveillance

11:10 a.m.  Court calls case.  DA cites appearances.  Atty Sebion appears via Zoom on behalf of def, who also appears via Zoom from ICJ.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Court explains what prelim is for.  Lt. Matt Foryan sworn in, direct by DA.  DA provides Exh#1 and #2 to officer during testimony.  Exh. #1 is Vilas County Jail booking photo.  Officer identifies def in photo and via Zoom.  Exh. #2 is copy of picture taken from surveillance footage.   DA moves for admission of exhibits.  Atty Sebion indicates she couldn't really see photographs that DA held up to camera but for purposes of prelim, accepts DA's description/explanation of what they are.  Court identifies def.  Court further describes exhibits.  Court admits exhibits.  Redirect by DA.  No recross.  Off record briefly to allow def to meet with atty in breakout room.  11:33, BOR.  DA argues for bindover.  Atty Sebion argues against bindover.  Court finds PC crime committed and Ferguson linked.  Further proceedings to be scheduled. DA will file Info.  Atty Sebion requests ARGN to be set.  Once Info filed, case to be scheduled.  Adj.  11:38 a.m.  klr
Preliminary hearing on August 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
No contact with R.L. or J.H.

10:41 a.m.  Court calls cases.  Def appears via Zoom from ICJ.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears in person for the State of WI.  Def lodged on warrant.  Per Court, not addressing cases with Atty Sebion.  Only addressing new case.  Def indicates Atty Sebion will be on this case also.  Not appointed yet.  Court indicates that it intends to forfeit bond on other cases.  Def states has not received a copy of the complaint.  Provided copy during hearing.  Court explains right to prelim and time limits in which to be held.  Def states he is not waiving any rights to prelim or time limits.  Court sets prelim for 8/10 at 11:00 a.m.  Warrant to be canceled in all cases.  DA requests NC with R.L. or J.H.  Also a flight risk.  DA requests $50,000 cash.  Court indicates is not forfeiting bonds yet.  DA indicates that posters on other cases are requesting their bonds to be revoked.  Court explains to def.  Will address at later date.  Def addresses Court.  Def states he was in Detroit taking care of mother who was ill.  Was not running.  Objects to $50,000.00.  Feels that a $20,000.00 cash bond would be more reasonable.  Court sets bond at $20,000.00 cash with NC with vics provision.  Def advised to call Ms. Sebion re prelim.  Adj.  10:56 a.m.  klr
Return on warrant on August 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
